meanings.definition: To remove carbon dioxide from (a substance)
meanings.sent1: Plants decarbonates the air during photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: The soda maker decarbonates the water to make it fizzy.
meanings.sent3: The decarbonating machine went haywire and turned everything into bubbles!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to decarbonate the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The decarbonating process is like a magic trick for gases.

meanings.definition: To undergo a reaction in which carbon dioxide is removed
meanings.sent2: The soda decarbonates when left open for too long.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter decided to decarbonate itself in the oven!
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to decarbonate all her worries away.
meanings.sent5: The decarbonating reaction was as swift as a ninja.
